intro: Guatteria japurensis, commonly known as the Japuré guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the rainforests of northern South America, particularly in regions of Venezuela and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Guatteria japurensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance in tropical ecosystems.
